etymologies: Middle English: probably from young+ man

definitions: a man holding and cultivating a small landed estate; a freeholder.
shortDefinitions: man holding and cultivating small landed estate

definitions: a person qualified for certain duties and rights, such as to serve on juries and vote for the knight of the shire, by virtue of possessing free land of an annual value of 40 shillings.
shortDefinitions: person qualified for certain duties and rights

definitions: a servant in a royal or noble household, ranking between a sergeant and a groom or a squire and a page.
shortDefinitions: servant in royal or noble household

definitions: a member of the yeomanry force.
(in the British Royal Navy and other Commonwealth navies) a petty officer concerned with signaling.
shortDefinitions: (in Royal and other Commonwealth navies) petty officer concerned with signalling

definitions: a petty officer in the US Navy or Coast Guard performing clerical duties on board ship.
shortDefinitions: petty officer in US navy performing clerical duties on board ship
